summary: An ordinance relating to the general municipal election of March 12, 1946; providing for the submission thereat of the initialive measure contemplated by voters' petition (Comptroller's File No. 187247) to establish a forty-eight hour week for uniformed members of the Fire Department and prohibit salary reductions in connection therewith; requiring the City Comptroller and ex-offico City Clerk to certify to the Election Board of King County said initiative measure in the form of a specified ballot title, and said initiative measure in full, and declaring an emergency.
